actions.text: Amendment SA 914 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 42 - 52. Record Vote Number: 224.

Amendment SA 914 proposed by Senator Lott to Amendment SA 905. (consideration: CR S7807-7810, S7819-7820; text: CR S7807) To require the Administrator of the FAA to conduct a study of safety standards at foreign repair stations.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 914 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 42 - 52. Record Vote Number: 224.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 914 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 42 - 52. Record Vote Number: 224.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 914 proposed by Senator Lott to Amendment SA 905.

amends_amendment.purpose: To provide safety and security with respect to aviation repair stations.

purpose: To require the Administrator of the FAA to conduct a study of safety standards at foreign repair stations.
